summary: An FBI 302 report documenting an interview conducted on August 16, 2019, with an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding his observations of Jeffrey Epstein's routine and his own movements prior to Epstein's death. The inmate provided no information about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at MCC, described by another inmate as being in the legal area from approximately 9am to 9pm and housed in cell 220 on L Tier.

events.title: Inmate Visit and Contraband Suspicion
events.description: An inmate (MCC Inmate #86824-054) received a visit from his girlfriend at MCC and was subsequently suspected of receiving contraband. He was placed in a dry room for approximately 25 hours.

events.title: FBI Interview at MCC
events.description: FBI Special Agents and an investigator interviewed MCC Inmate #86824-054 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding his observations and any information about Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
Cell 218, L-TIER, Special Housing Unit, MCC
keyFacts: The interview was conducted on August 16, 2019, regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.
The inmate witness (MCC Inmate #86824-054) stated he had no information regarding Epstein's death.
The inmate recalled that Jeffrey Epstein would be in the 'legal' area from approximately 9am to 9pm daily and was housed in cell 220 on L Tier.
The inmate was moved from cell 218 on L Tier to cell 111 on K Tier on August 9, 2019, after being suspected of receiving contraband during a visit from his girlfriend.
The document is an FBI 302 report, which is a summary of an investigative interview, and contains neither recommendations nor conclusions.
